item.title: Lecture 11: Analysis of RNA I: Molecular Biology of SARS-COV-2
item.description: A quick overview of coronavirus molecular biology Given the current situation we will continue this class using SARS-COV-2 as example for all further analyses. So far we have covered variant calling and genome assembly. Next we will be looking into RNAseq. Since SARS-COV-2 is a positive strand RNA virus that pretends to be a typical human transcript, it is a great system to learn about RNAseq. But first we need to learn about the coronavirus molecular biology.
